mph.beans.sessions

Interface ArtifactEditingFunctionalities

  • All Superinterfaces:
    UserEditingFunctionalities
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    StudentManagerRemote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StudentManager

    interface ArtifactEditingFunctionalities
extends UserEditingFunctionalities
    This interface provides methods to upload artifacts.
    It extends UserEditingFunctionalities.

    • Method Summary

      Get information about the artifact given as parameter

    • Method Detail

      • uploadArtifact

        ArtifactIdDTO uploadArtifact(TeamIdDTO theTeamId,
                           DeliverableIdDTO deliverableId,
                           OutcomingFileDTO theArtifact)
                             throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                    ForbiddenOperationException,
                                    UploadErrorException,
                                    UserNotLoggedInException
        Upload an artifact to the Server and register it into the system
        Parameters:
        theTeamId - the id of the team uploading the artifact
        deliverableId - the id of the deliverable referred by the artifact
        theArtifact - the object containing the file to upload
        Returns:
        the id of the newly registered artifact
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if one of the arguments is not valid
        ForbiddenOperationException - if the user is not allowed to execute this operation
        UploadErrorException - if an error occurs during the upload of the file
        UserNotLoggedInException - if the user is not logged in

      • getArtifactInfo

        ArtifactDTO getArtifactInfo(ArtifactIdDTO theArtifactId)
                            throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                   UserNotLoggedInException
        Get information about the artifact given as parameter
        Parameters:
        theArtifactId - the id of the artifact to get information from
        Returns:
        the DTO containing the artifact information
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if one of the arguments is not valid
        UserNotLoggedInException - if the user is not logged in
